title: Sea lion leaps from the surf and charges at couple - sending them fleeing in terror
text:
This is the hilarious moment a sea lion appears to make a beeline for a couple standing on the shore.

Mia Edwards and her boyfriend Michael Melvin from Phoenix, Arizona were standing on a beach with the waves lapping at their feet when the mammal made a surprise appearance last Saturday.

Grand Canyon University student Mia films her boyfriend standing in the shallow waters when suddenly she screams and pans to the mammal.

Mia Edwards films her boyfriend Michael Melvin from Phoenix, Arizona standing on the shore with the waves lapping at their feet on the unknown beach last Saturday (left). Suddenly a sea lion bark is heard and the mammal makes a beeline for the couple (right)

Mia posted the hilarious video on Twitter where it since has received 324,000 likes

The sea lion propels itself through the water causing Mia to scream (left). It is seen using its hind flippers to stand up on the sand (right)

Mia exclaims 'oh my god' before running towards the beach with Michael as the sea lion barks at the couple on the unknown beach.

She posted the video on Twitter where it has received more than 324,000 likes which she captioned: 'Here's live footage of Micheal and I minding our own business until a sea lion came charging at us from the ocean. Enjoy.'

Male sea lions can be very territorial and have been known to attack humans that come to close during mating season between May and June.

Mia Edwards screamed when she saw the sea lion coming towards her (left). She filmed the moment they ran away from the sea lion which shows the footprints in the sand on the beach (right)

The majority of California Sea Lions live in California but can also be spotted in British Columbia, Vancouver Island and off Mexico.

Sea lions use their flexible pelvic girdle by rotating their hind flippers which lie underneath their body to move on land

In water the mammals use their large front flippers to slice through the water and propel themselves forward.

A sea lion typically lives for twenty years and their age can be estimated by counting growth layers in their teeth.

It is also known that female sea lions tend to live longer than their male counterparts.
description: Mia Edwards and her boyfriend Michael Melvin from Phoenix, Arizona, were taken by surprise when a sea lion made a beeline for them as they stood on the unknown beach last Saturday.
